1.name: Cleopatra
1.description: The story of Cleopatra, the fabulous queen of Egypt, and the epic romances between her and the greatest men of Rome, Julius Caesar and Antony.

2.name: The Poor Little Rich Girl
2.description: The wealthy but selfish parents of a lonely young girl begin to rethink what is important to them after a servant's irresponsibility results in a crisis.

3.name: The Little Princess
3.description: Little Sara Crewe is placed in a boarding school by her father when he goes off to war, but he does not understand that the headmistress is a cruel, spiteful woman who makes life miserable ...                See full summary »

4.name: Terje Vigen
4.description: Terje Vigen, a sailor, suffers the loss of his family through the cruelty of another man. Years later, when his enemy's family finds itself dependent on Terje's beneficence, Terje must ...                See full summary »

5.name: Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm
5.description: With her family in financial difficulties, Rebecca is sent to live with her two strict, unfeeling aunts, who do not appreciate the young girl's charm and energy. Rebecca must make new ...                See full summary »

7.name: The Little American
7.description: A young American has her ship torpedoed by a German U-boat but makes it back to ancestral home in France, where she witnesses German brutality firsthand.

8.name: Straight Shooting
8.description: Cattleman Flint cuts off farmer Sims' water supply. When Sims' son Ted goes for water, one of Flint's men kills him. Cheyenne is sent to finish off Sims, but finding the family at the newly dug grave, he changes sides.

9.description: A retired judge comes West to restore a ghost town.

10.name: Satan's Rhapsody
10.description: A Faustian tale about an old woman who makes a pact with Mephisto to regain her youth, in return she must stay away from love. After the deal she meets two brothers who fall in love with her.

11.name: The Slave Market
11.description: Ramona is the daughter of the governor of Port Royal. She is a school girl living in Spain. John Barton, a soldier of fortune, is cast ashore in Spain penniless and scrapes an acquaintance ...                See full summary »

12.name: Blue Jeans
12.description: Perry Bascom comes to the town of Rising Sun, Indiana, to take charge of the sawmills which have for years been managed by his father's best friend, Col. Henry Clay Risener. His father's ...                See full summary »

13.name: The Hand That Rocks the Cradle
13.description: A doctor's wife is the head of a bureau that publishes and hands out literature on birth control. However, the police stop it and forbid her to speak in meetings about the secret that was ...                See full summary »

14.name: The Great Secret
14.description: A wealthy young athlete comes to the aid of a beautiful heiress, whose fortune is being threatened by two arch villains, The Great Master and Doctor Zulph.

15.name: Bucking Broadway
15.description: A ranch foreman battles a rich stockbroker for the affections of a beautiful young woman.

18.name: The Secret Man
18.description: Convict Cheyenne Harry escapes from prison in a garbage truck and boards a train, where he eludes capture with the help of passenger Henry Beaufort.

19.name: Umirayushchiy lebed
19.description: A grief-stricken ballerina becomes the obsession of an increasingly unhinged artist.

20.name: The Gray Ghost
20.description: Chapter 1: The Bank Mystery - Carlow (T.D. Crittenden'), a wealthy American living in London, is engaged to Lady Gwendolyn (Gertrude Astor) and has ordered from Arabin & Company, famous ...                See full summary »

21.name: The Silent Man
21.description: A gold prospector strikes it rich, but the crooks who run a frontier town take it away from him. He determines to get it back and clean up the town.

22.name: Les Misérables
22.description: Jean Valjean, a good and decent man who has committed a minor crime, is imprisoned but escapes. He is pursued thereafter for years by Javert, the cruel and implacable arm of the law.

23.name: The Golem and the Dancing Girl
23.description: As a practical joke, an actor impersonates the screen monster he made famous. Complications ensue.

24.name: Patria
24.description: Serial about Japanese spies trying to invade the US but whose plans are foiled by a rich heiress and a Secret Service agent.

25.name: Tom Sawyer
25.description: Tom Sawyer, a young Missouri lad, finds fun and adventure with his pals Joe Harper and Huckleberry Finn, running away to hide out on Jackson's Island and pretending to be Mississippi River ...                See full summary »

26.name: Das Bildnis des Dorian Gray
26.description: A variation of the famous Oscar Wilde tale in which Dorian Gray's soul is manifested in a painting instead of his own body.

27.name: The Woman God Forgot
27.description: Cortez sends Alvarado to Montezuma who throws him into a dungeon from which he is rescued by Tecza who loves him. He is recaptured when her lover Guatemoco finds Alvarado hiding in her ...                See full summary »

28.name: The Torture of Silence
28.description: Sad story of an unfaithful wife and her subsequent sufferings as a mother.

29.name: Hilde Warren und der Tod
29.description: Hilde Warren, a famous actress, is impregnated by a convicted murderer and becomes plagued by visions of an extremely gaunt and sepulchral Death. Upon discovering her child is the image of ...                See full summary »

30.name: The Pride of the Clan
30.description: Among the simple fisher-folk of a little island off the west coast of Scotland lives MacTavish, head of a clan. Here he rules as a chieftain and his word is law. One day a hurricane sweeps ...                See full summary »

31.name: Runaway Romany
31.description: "Inky" Ames, theatrical press agent, through a fictitious story makes it appear that Anitra St. Clair, an actress, is the long lost daughter of Theodore True, the copper king. True accepts ...                See full summary »

32.name: Princess Virtue
32.description: Count Oudoff, a fortune-hunting European nobleman, marries a wealthy American widow and brings his new wife and her pretty young daughter, Liane, back to Paris. When word gets around that ...                See full summary »

33.name: Hamlet
33.description: Hamlet suspects his uncle has murdered his father to claim the throne of Denmark and the hand of Hamlet's mother, but the prince cannot decide whether or not he should take vengeance.

34.name: A Romance of the Redwoods
34.description: A young girl travels west to live with her uncle during the California Gold Rush only to find that he has been killed by Indians and his identity assumed by an outlaw.

35.name: El apóstol
35.description: Argentinian President Yrigoyen burns Buenos Aires using Jupiter's thunderbolts.

36.name: On Dangerous Ground
36.description: Bradford Stewart, a young American surgeon studying in Germany, is dining in Cologne with a German friend, Ritter Bloem, a philosopher and a patriotic German. The latter is called away by ...                See full summary »

37.name: Madame Du Barry
37.description: Jeanette (Theda Bara), unknown in Paris but of great beauty and wit, attracts the attention of Louis XV (Charles Clary) who expresses a desire to meet her to Jean Du Barry (Herschel Mayall)...                See full synopsis »

38.name: A Tale of Two Cities
38.description: Alcoholic lawyer Sydney Carton travels to Paris during the Reign of Terror to rescue French aristocrat Charles Darnay, husband of the woman he loves.

39.name: Polly of the Circus
39.description: When circus aerialist Polly Fisher is injured, she is taken to the nearby home of minister John Hartley. The two fall in love and marry secretly. But when the news leaks out, the minister ...                See full summary »

40.name: The Black Stork
40.description: A young man and woman are considering marriage; eugenicist Harry J Haiselden warns that they are ill-matched and will produce defective offspring. He is right; their baby is born defective,...                See full summary »

41.name: Wild and Woolly
41.description: A rich young Easterner who has always wanted to live in "the Wild West" plans to move to a Western town. Unknown to him, the town's "wild" days are long gone, and it is an orderly, ...                See full summary »

42.name: Panthea
42.description: A woman sacrifices everything for her husband's career.

43.name: A Modern Musketeer
43.description: A restless young man travels west, encountering adventure, romance, and danger.

44.name: Reaching for the Moon
44.description: A factory worker has always dreamed that he was meant for better things, to be rich and famous and in "the company of kings". One day he discovers that he is indeed the only heir to the ...                See full summary »

46.name: A Mormon Maid
46.description: This silent melodrama is set against the 1840s westward migration of the Mormons. Dora, a young woman, and her family are saved from an Indian attack by a Mormon community traveling to Utah...                See full summary »

47.name: Draft 258
47.description: Mary Alden and her brothers Matthew and George have extremely different political views. Matthew is a committed pacifist, and is constantly giving speeches against war. George is notified ...                See full summary »

48.name: Betsy Ross
48.description: Revolutionary War heroine Betsy Ross finds herself in competition with her sister for the affections of a British soldier.

49.name: Sangre y arena
49.description: Juan Gallardo, a poor but ambitious young shoemaker's son in Southern Spain yearns to be a matador. To that end he and his companions set out for Seville where he eventually finds fame and ...                See full summary »

50.name: Down to Earth
50.description: A healthy outdoors-type follows the girl he loves to a resort for wealthy hypochondriacs. In order to prove to her and the other patients that their "illnesses" are all in their minds, he ...                See full summary »
